column1: If 2 wrongs dont make a right, what do 2 rights make? an airplane.
column3: In this joke, right can refer to both the moral correctness (in a right/wrong context) and the direction (as in right turns).
column4: It is important to do what is right, even if it is difficult.
column5: Turn right at the next intersection to reach the park.

column1: What do dna and diarrhea have in common? they both run in your jeans (genes)
column3: The word jeans refers to the clothing item, while genes refers to the hereditary factors in biology.
column4: I bought a new pair of jeans for the summer.
column5: Scientists study how genes influence physical traits in organisms.
